alert.note: Alert for St. Clair (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 9:22PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern St. Clair County through 1015 PM CDT... At 922 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Talladega Superspeedway, or 9 miles north of Talladega, moving west at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Pell City, Leeds, Moody, Springville, Odenville, Margaret, Argo, Riverside, Bald Rock, Logan Martin Lake, Coosa Island, Harrisburg, Branchville, St. Clair County Airport, Wattsville, Chula Vista, Camp Winnataska and Cropwell. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for central and east central Alabama.
